name: gist

the most important pieces of information about something, or general information without details: get the gist We got the gist, but not every word.the gist of I was just about able to grasp the gist of their argument.for gist Reading for gist requires less detailed comprehension.
More examplesFewer examplesI got the gist of their conversation.As I understand it, this is the gist of their argument.He told me the gist of it.Just give me the gist.I only understood the gist.Here's the gist: the answer is to be in control. I won't continue, but you'll have got my gist by now.That was the basic gist.I might get the general gist, but miss the nuances.
